What is the square root of 16?
What is the value of π (pi) to two decimal places?
What is the smallest prime number?
3 raised to the power of 3 is 27.
What is the perimeter of a square with side length 5?
The perimeter of a square is 4 times the side length.
What is 10 to the power of 2?
10 raised to the power of 2 is 100.
If a triangle has angles 60° and 90°, what is the third angle?
The sum of angles in a triangle is 180°.
What is the value of the expression 3 + 5 * 2?
Using the order of operations, 5*2=10, then 3+10=13.
What is the greatest common divisor of 12 and 16?
2 raised to the power of 5 is 32.
What is the area of a rectangle with length 7 and width 4?
The area of a rectangle is length times width.
What is the value of 0! (zero factorial)?
What comes next in the sequence: 2, 4, 6, 8?
The pattern increases by 2 each time.
Which of these numbers is a prime number?
11 is the only prime number in the options.
If a train travels at 60 km/hr, how far does it travel in 2 hours?
Which number is a multiple of both 2 and 3?
6 is a multiple of both 2 and 3.
If you have 5 apples and give 2 away, how many are left?
If a box contains 3 red balls and 2 blue balls, how many balls are in the box?
What is the next number in the sequence: 5, 10, 15?
The pattern increases by 5 each time.
Which is the smallest even number?
If there are 24 candies and 4 people, how many candies does each get if shared equally?
24 candies divided by 4 people is 6 each.
What comes next in the sequence: 3, 6, 9?
The pattern increases by 3 each time.
Which of these is an odd number?
7 is the only odd number in the options.
If a vehicle travels 50 km in an hour, how far will it travel in 3 hours?
What is the result of 3 + 3 x 3?
3 + (3 x 3) is 3 + 9 = 12, due to order of operations.
Who was the first Prime Minister of independent India?
Jawaharlal Nehru served as India's first Prime Minister from 1947 to 1964.
In which year did India gain independence from British rule?
Who is known as the 'Father of the Indian Constitution'?
Dr. B. R. Ambedkar was the principal architect of the Indian Constitution.
Which movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi in 1942?
The Quit India Movement was launched by Gandhi in 1942 to demand an end to British rule in India.
Who was the first woman Prime Minister of India?
Indira Gandhi became the first woman Prime Minister of India in 1966.
Which Indian king is known for spreading Buddhism?
Emperor Ashoka promoted Buddhism after the Kalinga War.
Where did the Jallianwala Bagh massacre take place?
The Jallianwala Bagh massacre occurred in Amritsar in 1919.
Who was the founder of the Maurya Empire?
Chandragupta Maurya founded the Maurya Empire in 321 BCE.
What was the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire?
Hampi served as the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire.
Who was known as the 'Iron Man of India'?
Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was known as the 'Iron Man of India' for his role in uniting India.
In which year did India become a republic?
India became a republic on January 26, 1950.
Who was the Mughal emperor during the first Battle of Panipat?
The first Battle of Panipat in 1526 was fought between Babur and Ibrahim Lodi.
Which Indian freedom fighter is associated with the slogan 'Give me blood and I will give you freedom'?
Subhas Chandra Bose gave this slogan to inspire Indians to fight for independence.
Who was the last Viceroy of British India?
Lord Louis Mountbatten served as the last Viceroy of British India.
Which dynasty built the famous Khajuraho temples?
The Khajuraho temples were built by the Chandela dynasty between 950 and 1050 AD.
Who wrote the national anthem of India?
Rabindranath Tagore wrote 'Jana Gana Mana', India's national anthem.
Who was the leader of the 1857 revolt in Jhansi?
Rani Lakshmibai led the 1857 revolt in Jhansi against the British.
What was the main occupation of the Indus Valley people?
Agriculture was the main occupation of the Indus Valley civilization.
Who introduced the Persian style of architecture in India?
Babur introduced Persian-style architecture, which evolved under the Mughal dynasty.
Which city is known as the 'City of Joy' in India?
Kolkata is known as the 'City of Joy', popularized by a book of the same name.
Who was the founder of the Sikh religion?
Guru Nanak founded Sikhism in the 15th century.
Who gave the slogan 'Swaraj is my birthright, and I shall have it'?
Tilak gave this slogan to demand self-rule for India.
Which ruler built the Red Fort in Delhi?
Shah Jahan built the Red Fort in Delhi in the mid-17th century.
Which river was the site of the ancient Indus Valley Civilization?
The Indus Valley Civilization was based along the Indus River.
Who led the Dandi March in 1930?
Mahatma Gandhi led the Dandi March to protest the British salt tax in 1930.
